intro: Galium novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including New Guinea, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Galium novoguineense is often found in forest understories and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
